properties.event summary: 09/15/2011: On Thursday in the early morning, on Avenida Universidad, Matamoros, Tamaulipas, Mexico, armed men and military personnel engaged in a shootout. No casualties or damages were reported. No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
properties.event title: Armed Men and Military Personnel Engage in Shootout in Matamoros, Tamaulipas
properties.location: The incident occured on Avendia Universidad, Matamoros, Tamulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 09/22/2011: On Thursday, in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico, military personnel were attacked while on patrol on the Matamoros-Monterrey bypass road. The six attackers fired upon the personnel assigned to the IV Military Region. The soldiers repelled the attack and killed two gunmen and arrested four. There were no damages reported and no group claimed responsibility for the attack.
properties.event title: Armed Militants Attack Military Convoy in Tamaulipas, Mexico
properties.location: The attack occurred along the Libramiento Matamoros-Monterrey road in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 09/24/2011: On Saturday, in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, Mexico, a group of militants attacked a military convoy. The convoy was on Calle Prolongacion Nicaragua, in Colonia Los Olivos when the attack occurred. The military personnel returned fire killing four of the attackers. The unit that was attacked was from the IV Military Region. No group claimed responsibility for the armed assault.
properties.event title: Militants Attack Mlitary Convoy in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas
properties.location: The attack occurred on Calle Prolongacion Nicaragua, Colonia Los Olivos  in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, Mecixo.

properties.event summary: 10/10/2011:  On Monday, in Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico, four armed men attacked military personnel on patrol during a reconnaissance mission on Calle Antonio Alzate, Colonia Mezquite.  The military personnel were participating in "Operation Northeast," assigned to IV Military Region.  No damages or casualties were reported.  No group claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Four Armed Men Attack Military Personnel in Miguel Aleman, Mexico
properties.location: The armed assault occurred on Calle Antonio Alzate, Colonia Mezquite in Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/23/2011:  On Sunday, in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico, five armed men were killed during an armed assault between Mexican Military personnel and the unidentified armed perpetrators.  The armed men began firing at Military personnel, who then returned fire resulting in the five casualties.  No group claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Five Armed Men Killed in Reynosa, Mexico
properties.location: The armed assault occurred in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/23/2011:  On Sunday, in Matamoros, Tamaulipas, Mexico, armed men open fired at military personnel from a building.  The armed men fled from the scene after the assault.  No damages or casualties were reported.  No group claimed responsibility for the armed assault.
properties.event title: Armed Men Attack Military Personnel from Building in Matamoros, Mexico
properties.location: The armed assault occurred in a building in Victoria section of Matamoros, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/25/2011 (default date): On Tuesday, in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, Mexico, gunmen opened fire on  Mexican Army personnel with a rifle on a street in Colonia America. They also threw a grenade. Army personnel retaliated, causing unknown amount of casualties and seized contraband. No group claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Gunmen Attack Military Personnel with Rifle
properties.location: The assault occurred on a street in Colonia America, Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 09/27/2011: On Tuesday, on Federal Tampico and Mante Federal highway, near Altamira Municipality, Tamaulipas, Mexico, an undetermined number of armed individuals assaulted the Military Personnel of the IV Military Region and they returned fire and killed three individuals. Military personnel were conducting ground patrols when they were assaulted. No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
properties.event title: Mexican Military was Attacked by Armed Men in Tamaulipas, Mexico
properties.location: Incident occurred on Tampico and Mante Federal highway, near Altamira Municipality, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 09/27/2011: On Tuesday, near kilometer marker 219, of Ciudad Victoria and Mante road, Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, Mexico, armed individuals assaulted military personnel of the IV Military Region and the troops returned fire. Military personnel were conducting ground patrols when they were assaulted by armed individuals. No casualties were reported for this incident. No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Attacked by Gunmen in Tamaulipas, Mexico
properties.location: The incident occurred near kilometer marker 219, of Ciudad Victoria and Mante road, in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 09/27/2011: On Tuesday, on Colonia Jardines de Champayan, Tampico Municipality, Tamaulipas, Mexico, armed individuals assaulted Military personnel of the IV Military Region and they returned fire. Military personnel were conducting ground patrols when they were assaulted by armed individuals who traveled on board a vehicle. No casualties were reported for this incident. No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
properties.event title: Mexican Army Attacked by Gunmen in Tampico, Tamaulipas
properties.location: Incident occurred on Colonia Jardines de Champayan, Tampico Municipality, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/15/2011: On Saturday, in the prison referred to as CEDES in Matamoros, Tamaulipas, Mexico, twenty unidentified inmates were killed and 12 were left injured. The incident was linked to conflict attributed to drug cartel rivalry. The article does not state how the killings occurred. No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
properties.event title: Massacre in a Prison Takes Place in Tamaulipas, Mexico
properties.location: The massacre occurred in the prison referred to as CEDES in Matamoros, Tamaulipas, Mexico

properties.event summary: 10/02/2011: On Sunday night, in San Fernando, Tamaulipas, Mexico, a shootout occurred between rival gangs. Seven gang members were suspected to have been killed. The names of the gangs or members involved were not reported. No group claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Rival Gangs Shootout in San Fernando, Tamaulipas, Mexico
properties.location: The incident occurred in San Fernando, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 12/02/2011: On Friday morning at 0945, in Tampico, Tamaulipas, Mexico, a confrontation between civilians and Federal SEDENA agents left five injured. The attack occurred on Carretera Tampico-Mante and Avenida Las Torres. Three civilians not involved in the clash were injured. Two individuals were arrested for the armed assault.
properties.event title: Five Injured in Armed Assault in Tampico, Mexico
properties.location: The armed assault occurred on Carretera Tampico-Mante and Avenida Las Torres.

properties.event summary: 11/28/2011: On Monday, in Fraccionamiento Flores in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, Mexico, State police personnel were involved in a shootout with armed men.  The article does not specify any further information.  The following day Navy personnel searched several of the residences in the neighborhood.  No group claimed responsibility for this incident.  No casualties were reported for this incident.
properties.event title: Shootout Between Armed Men and State Police in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas
properties.location: The incident occurred in in Fraccionamiento Flores in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 12/03/2011: On Saturday night at 0040 in Colonia Aztlan, Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico, a four-hour confrontation between Mexican army personnel and organized crime members resulted in the partial destruction of a criminal safe house and two arrests. The first confrontation began with three large explosions, and then sporadic gunfire eruped until 0430. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Organized Criminals Clash with Mexican Army Personnel in Reynosa
properties.location: The assault occurred at a safehouse in Colonia Aztlan, Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 12/02/2011: On Friday night between 0100 and 0300, in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico, organized crime members clashed with Mexican army personnel. Grenades and gunfire were used in the attack. The clash began at 0100 and ended at 0300. No casualties or damages were reported and no group claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Army and Organized Crime Members Clash in Reynosa, Tamaulipas
properties.location: The clash occurred in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 12/10/2011: On Saturday, at the intersection of Avenida Independencia and 16 de Septiembre, Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, Mexico, unidentified gunmen attacked military personnel by gunfire who were participating in reconnaissance. Military personnel returned fire, resulting in 11 militant deaths, two arrests, and one injury to a soldier. Authorities also seized contraband. No group claimed responsibility. No damages were reported.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Attacked During Reconnaissance in Tamaulipas, Mexico
properties.location: The assault occurred at the intersection of Avenida Independencia and 16 de Septiembre, Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 12/10/2011: On Saturday, in Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, Mexico, unknown gunmen attacked a military patrol. The military fired back killing two gunmen and capturing 11 others. No group claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Armed Men and Military Personnel were in a Confrontation in Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas
properties.location: The incident occurred in Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 09/22/2011: On Thursday, on the Matamoros-Monterrey bypass road, in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico, military personnel killed two and arrested four militants after an attack was initiated by the militants. The military seized eight firearms, 1,320 rounds, 54 magazines, two grenades and one vehicle.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Defeat Militants During Attack and Recover Weapons in Tamaulipas
properties.location: The incident occurred along the Libramiento Matamoros-Monterrey road in Reynosa,Tamaulipas, Mexico

properties.event summary: 09/24/2011: On Saturday in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, Mexico, a group of militants attacked a military convoy. The convoy was on Calle Prolongacion Nicaragua, Colonia Los Olivos when the attack occurred. The military personnel returned fire killing four of the attackers. The unit that was attacked was from the IV Military Region. The military personnel recovered four rifles, 56 magazines for various weapons, 1,500 bullets of various calibers, and a vehicle.
properties.event title: Military Convoy Kills Attackers in Nuevo Laredo, Mexico
properties.location: The attack was on Calle Prolongacion Nicaragua, Colonia Los Olivos  in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, Mecixo.

properties.event summary: 10/10/2011:  On Monday, in Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico, military personnel detained four armed men for armed assault.  The men were arrested while attacking the military personnel.  During the arrest, military personnel recovered five rifles, one pistol, 1239 bullets of various calibers, 51 magazines of various calibers, and one vehicle.  No damages were reported.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Detain Four Armed Men in Miguel Aleman, Mexico
properties.location: The arrests occurred in Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/23/2011:  On Sunday, in Matamoros, Tamaulipas, Mexico, military personnel came under fire from a building.  The gunmen evaded capture, but military personnel secured 202 marijuana plants 1.25 meters tall, 75 marijuana plants 45 centimeters tall, and 206 marijuana plants 7 centimeters tall.  No damages were reported.  No group claimed responsibility for the armed assault.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Secure Drugs in Matamoros, Mexico
properties.location: The military operation occurred in a building in Matamoros, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/25/2011 (default date): On Tuesday in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, Mexico, Mexican army personnel were confronted by a group of armed gunmen who shot at them when they arrived on a street they were watching. Army personnel killed one gunman and arrested four on the street in Colonia America. They also seized rifles, cartridges, a grenade, tire spikes, and four trailers. They also seized five rifles, 1,690 live rounds, 65 magazines, one grenade, 30 tire spikes, two vehicles, and $700 MXN ($52 USD). No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
properties.event title: Military Seizes Contraband and Kills Gunman
properties.location: The operation occurred on a street in Colonia America, Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 12/03/2011: On Saturday night at 0040 in Colonia Aztlan, Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico, a four-hour confrontation between Mexican army personnel and organized crime members resulted in two arrests. Military personnel entered a residence during the gunfire and arrested two people. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Criminal Safe House Partially Destroyed After Four Hour Gunfight
properties.location: The operation occurred in Colonia Aztlan, Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 12/10/2011: On Saturday at the intersection of Avenida Independencia and 16 de Septiembre, Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, Mexico, unidentified gunmen attacked military personnel by gunfire who were participating in reconnaissance. Military personnel returned fire, resulting in 11 militant deaths, two arrests, and one injury to a soldier. The military also seized 73 firearms, 3730 bullets, 422 magazines, seven cartridge belts, four bulletproof vests, and two vehicles. No group claimed responsibility. No damages were reported.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Kill Eleven Militants, Arrest Two in Tamaulipas,Mexico
properties.location: The assault occurred at the intersection of Avenida Independencia and 16 de Septiembre, Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 12/10/2011: On Saturday, in Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, Mexico, military personnel arrested two individuals after being attacked by gunmen. The military fired back killing 11 gunmen and seized the following items: 73 rifles and more than 3,000 rounds of ammunition.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Arrested Eighteen Individuals in Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas
properties.location: The incident occurred in Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, Mexico.
